page.title: 03Farming _ Leck area
page.content: Because of the high rainfall area, and the small size and roughness of the fields, cereal crops are not often grown. Farms are either mixed, dairy, beef,sheep or further up the fell, sheep farming with perhaps suckler cows.There is too much milk produced in the E.E.C.so farmers are now encouraged to go out of milk production and concentrate on beef farming. Some of the older farmers who want life a little easier do this Sometimes beef cows are sold as store cattle to farmers further down Lanca- shire to fatten off on better land. There is very little poultry and pig farming. The biggest number of animals on farms in our area is sheep followed by dairy cattle followed by beef cattle. The only crop apart from hay and silage is a few acres of barley.
